subject: RE: [junit] jUnit bug? textui - no errors, gui - errors.
msgSnippet: Thanks for the information.  I m new to this list - how do I find the archives? For everyone - I don t use jUnit as the topmost interface to my testing
messageBody:
Thanks for the information. I'm new to this list - how do I find the
archives?

For everyone - I don't use jUnit as the topmost interface to my testing
application - I call jUnit's classes after setting up some other resources.

Thus, it has to run right the first time. Is there a way to turn off class
reloading by default? (so I can find out if this will prevent this
problem)?

Thanks,
Bret

-----Original Message-----
From: Erik Hanson [mailto:ehanson@...]
Sent: Friday, October 26, 2001 1:59 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] jUnit bug? textui - no errors, gui - errors.


"Bret Waldow" <Bret.Waldow@...> wrote:
> No, it works if I turn off class reloading.
>
> What does this mean? Is there a workaround?

It means that the problem is probably with JUnit's classloader :)

I don't know what else it means, since I don't know much about JUnit's
classloader. If you search this list's archives, you'll find some messages
that go on in great detail about the classloader.


Erik
